intro: Dombeya lucida var. hafobalofotsy, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
